articles.title: James Webb telescope unveils largest-ever map of the universe, spanning over 13 billion years
articles.description: The largest map of the universe, created with data from the James Webb Space Telescope, shows almost 800,000 galaxies crammed into a tiny piece of sky and spanning almost all of time.
articles.content:
A tiny sliver of the new COSMOS map showing an incredibly diverse collection of galaxies, created from a recent sky survey by JWST.
Scientists have unveiled the largest map of the universe ever created. Stretching across a tiny sliver of space and al... [2734 chars]

articles.title: Kilmar Abrego Garcia is back in the U.S. to face criminal charges : NPR
articles.description: Abrego Garcia faces criminal charges for allegedly transporting migrants without legal status around the country, according to a Justice Department indictment.
articles.content:

articles.title: NASA, ISRO to study muscle regeneration in space
articles.description: Findings from this study could help develop interventions to maintain muscle health during extended space missions and in people suffering from age-related muscle loss on Earth.
articles.content: The National Aeronautics and Space Administration (NASA) and the Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) will collaborate on a series of scientific investigations aboard Axiom Mission 4 — the fourth private astronaut mission to the International Sp... [2323 chars]

articles.description: Wine grape growers grappling with declining sales and rising expenses hope advancements in autonomous technology can help safeguard the industry.

articles.title: El Salvador returns mistakenly deported man to face people smuggling charges in the US
articles.description: The US Supreme Court had ordered Kilmar Abrego Garcia’s return saying the Trump administration had cited no basis for what it called his “warrantless arrest”.
articles.content:
Washington: The man mistakenly deported from Maryland to El Salvador by the Trump administration has returned to the United States to face criminal charges of transporting illegal immigrants within the US, Attorney-General Pam Bondi said.

articles.title: P200 wage hike to cause layoffs, PH retailers warn
articles.description: The country’s largest group of retailers warned that the P200 wage hike bill passed by the House of Representatives could lead to layoffs.
articles.content:
MANILA, Philippines — The country’s largest group of retailers warned that the P200 wage hike bill passed by the House of Representatives could lead to layoffs and cause even more problems.

articles.title: Summer Game Fest 2025: all the news, trailers, and announcements
articles.description: Summer Game Fest returns for 2025, with new game announcements for the Xbox, PS5, and Nintendo Switch 2.
articles.content:
It’s that time of year again. With E3 done and gone , Summer Game Fest has taken its place, and it always makes for a busy few days in gaming.

articles.title: Supreme Court grants DOGE access to confidential Social Security records
articles.description: The order, for now, overturns actions that limited DOGE's access to sensitive private information. In a separate case, the court said DOGE did not have to share internal records with a watchdog group.
articles.content:

articles.description: Atomic Heart II is coming from Mundfish after the first game successfully reached more than 10 million players.

articles.title: Dow, S&P 500, Nasdaq Rise After Jobs Report; Trump Announces New China Talks; Trump-Musk Spat; Tesla, DJT, and More Movers
articles.description: The Dow Jones Industrial Average, the S&P 500, and the Nasdaq Composite rallied Friday as the stock market digested the May jobs report and the fallout between President Donald Trump and Tesla CEO Elon Musk.
articles.content:
Pinned Post
The stock market’s rally continued in the wake of Friday’s jobs report as the major indexes are off to their best start to a month so far this year.
